meanings.definition: Chudders (noun): a person who chatters incessantly
meanings.sent1: The classroom was always noisy because of the chudders who never stopped talking.
meanings.sent2: My little sister is a real chudders; she talks from the moment she wakes up until she falls asleep.
meanings.sent3: The chudders in the office made it hard for anyone to concentrate on their work.
meanings.sent4: Her mouth moved like a chudders, never taking a break from the constant chatter.
meanings.sent5: The chudders at the party dominated every conversation with their non-stop talking.

meanings.definition: Chudders (verb): to make a continuous, low rumbling sound
meanings.sent1: The old car engine chudders noisily when starting up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The distant thunder chudders softly in the background as the storm approaches.
meanings.sent3: The washing machine chudders rhythmically as it goes through its spin cycle.
meanings.sent4: The train chudders along the tracks, creating a soothing sound for passengers.
meanings.sent5: The wind chudders through the trees, creating a calming atmosphere in the forest.

meanings.definition: Chudders (adjective): characterized by constant talking or noise
meanings.sent1: The chudders group of friends always had something to say about everything.
meanings.sent2: The chudders neighbors could be heard arguing loudly every night.
meanings.sent3: The chudders party next door kept me up all night with their loud music.
meanings.sent4: The chudders radio station played non-stop music throughout the day.
meanings.sent5: The chudders birds outside my window woke me up every morning with their chirping.
